glsa.title: libsoup: Arbitrary remote code execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in libsoup might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: libsoup is an HTTP client/server library for GNOME.

description.p: A stack based buffer overflow vulnerability was discovered in libsoup.

impact.p: A remote attacker, by using specially crafted HTTP requests, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All libsoup users should upgrade to the latest version:
Packages which depend on this library may need to be recompiled. Tools such as revdep-rebuild may assist in identifying some of these packages.
